snippet: The business climate has worsened since President Hamid Karzai delayed his signing of the security deal, with rising food and fuel prices and a slump in lending and investment.
abstract: Stubborn impasse over a long-term security deal with the United States has put an instant and alarming drag on the Afghan business climate, which was already suffering as Western forces have pulled out; nearly every anecdotal indicator of economic confidence has turned negative in the days since Pres Hamid Karzai insisted on delaying his signing of the agreement.
lead_paragraph: The business climate has worsened since President Hamid Karzai delayed his signing of the security deal, with rising food and fuel prices and a slump in lending and investment.

headline.main: Impasse Over Security Deal Adds to Afghan Economy’s Troubles
headline.print_headline: Impasse Over Security Deal Adds to Afghan Economy’s Troubles
